website_summaries.verdict: While this push walker is on the expensive side, it's sturdy with a classic look many parents love.
pros: Weight helps prevent slips and falls
Sides lower so baby can crawl inside for a ride
cons: Handle isn't as well made as the rest of the wagon and has been known to break or crack

customer_reviews.title: Great for twins
customer_reviews.text: My twins who just turned one cannot walk yet but they really enjoy pushing each other around in this little wagon. It may be the cutest thing on the planet. 😃
customer_reviews.author: BBOliver

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: The description says resist push, well it has no such thing. Your kid will fly forward and backwards if he is not quite stable and walking already. Definitely not for beginners. Returned it for a refund but had to pay $20 to ship it back since it was impossible to take apart. The only way to take it apart would have been breaking the wheels. So do not get it if you are unsure if it works for you. Returning it will be a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Maria G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: We love love this wagon. Bought it for our daughter for her first birthday as she was starting to cruise but not walking. She absolutely loves this and her favorite thing to do is walk around the house finding things to put inside the wagon. The wagon is sturdy and well made, heavy enough that it does not slip out from under her. I appreciate the click sound it makes so I can hear her coming! We have put her in the wagon and pushed her around too. Even when she is walking unassisted I see her using this to pick up toys and moving laundry.
customer_reviews.author: MtMuchacha

customer_reviews.title: Missing Wheels in Package!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for our child, and she was all excited about it! We didn't think to do a parts inventory on such as expensive toy before starting the assembly and got all the way to the end only to discover that two out of the four wheels are missing in the sealed package! This is unacceptable for a toy that costs $80! The manufacturer needs to do much better quality control. Now we have to wait for the replacement, and we have a child who was upset and crying that we have to return her gift. Will never buy from this manufacturer again.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Our 12 month old granddaughter loves this. She gets in we push (yep out of breath and everything!). She loves putting toys into and taking them out. I love that this toy is built like a tank. It is very heavy and well made. Two features I don't care for is the front "bumper". Its hard plastic. I was thinking it would be more of a soft rubber/foam. The second is you can't turn corners easy. When we are racing around it does present a challenge. But I am developing a secret technique - I have to if I am to beat Grandpa! And GrannyRose always wins!!
customer_reviews.author: GrannyRose

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the quality I expected from radio flyer and the amount of money spent!!! The wood construction is shoddy. One of the holes in which you have to insert a cam-lock type nut (ew) is not drilled in the correct spot. Therefore the bolt holding the side of the wagon into the back will not screw in straight. It sticks out an inch. It's too much hassle to return now since it's mostly put together and my son can't wait till I finish it. But I'm going to have to hack at the hole to get it to line up properly. Shoddy shoddy shoddy
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I just got done putting it together so baby hasn't used it yet. Noramlly I'd have hubby assemble it but me and my 4 yr old put it together easy and quick on our own. Giving it 5 stars because I like it and it seems good quality. Baby is napping so she hasn't used it yet and of course we have no idea how it will hold up over the years, but good first impression. Oh, as you can see in first picture, the back slat isn't completely centered and I can hardly stand it! Almost gave it 4 stars for that but.... Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Vance E.

customer_reviews.title: Lasting through lots of phases
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of our best buys. You have to hesitate to bring more stuff in the house, since so much goes unused. But this wagon was of great interest to our toddler as she was pulling herself up to walk, all through assisted walking and now even walking she uses it to experiment with speed. She loves deciding which toys will go in the wagon at any given time. It's also been fun to watch her learn to steer it. Some comments about the wooden slats have been negative, but I think they're fine -- she loves to take them out and walk around with them so it's good that they're light.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, but child loves it
customer_reviews.text: This walker has several benefits over the competition: it's easy on the eyes and can store toys/other items inside. It will look cute next to the tree at Christmas. However, in my opinion it should be half the price that it is because it does not come assembled, has poorly designed features (the plastic "clickers" which do not work) and uses low quality materials that seem likely to break (such as the wooden side panels). I am not pleased with the quality of the product, however now that it is assembled, my 10-month-old daughter loves using it, so we are going to giving it a chance. I probably would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: If you wouldn't like it without the cute sideboards DON'T BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest little wagon you'll ever find anywhere. The sideboards make it perfect for the youngest children to play with. They can put stuff in the wagon. Push it around. PROBLEM: The sideboards last about 2 minutes and then they break. Just go ahead and throw them away when it arrives. The child who broke these sideboards is 9 months old. He leaned over into the wagon and pop. No more cute sideboards!
customer_reviews.author: T. B. Kerns

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and non-tipping walker for your soon-to-be walking little gal/guy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and put together for our little babe around 7/8 months - she kind of avoided it (haha) and we thought was a waste of money, but then lo and behold, around 12 months got super interested in this (after she'd already been walking for a few weeks) and hasn't looked back! The wagon is very very sturdy and has never tipped over when she's used it, even when she tries to climb into it. Worth the extra money, nothing is worse than seeing your little one fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves his new walker wagon
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this wagon. He is 10 1/2 m/o and has been really looking forward to walking. He is so obsessed with this wagon that whenever he sees it parked somewhere he gets out of control wanting to reach out and grab it and practice his walking skills. The wagon itself is well-built with a cute classic look. I like the leather used on the front side to prevent damage/impact on the walls and furniture as the baby is learning to maneuver his wagon throughout the house. After baby is done with it I can see myself using it as a nice piece of decor.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: A great choice!!
customer_reviews.text: A great choice!! Perfect gift for our 1 yr old granddaughter who wants to practice independent walking. She loves pushing this everywhere and loves to have her 4 year old brother ride in front as she pushes. Well built. A little on the heavy side, but that doesn't stop a one year old from pushing it. The wheels roll easily. It is a little difficult to steer as the wheels don't turn right or left, but the kids figure it out. Removable sides allows them to load it up with dolls, dinosaurs, blocks or each other. I'm so happy I chose this for my grandchildren! They have spent hours pushing this wagon around.
customer_reviews.author: JRL

customer_reviews.title: Best wagon ever!
customer_reviews.text: My one year old loves this wagon. He pushes it, crawls into it, sits in it, throws his toys in it, etc. We used it over the weekend so he could prance down the wedding aisle alongside the flower girl. We attached a sign to the front that said, “ Here comes the Bride” and arranged hydrangeas and magnolia leaves in the wagon itself! My sweet boy was a confident and happy camper strutting his stuff with his little red wagon! Definitely read the directions when assembling. It takes a good 1-2 hours if not! Ha!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So sturdy!  Perfect for a baby learning to walk...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Our pediatrician suggested we purchase a push walker to help our little guy take his first steps and learn some independent movement. He’s 13 months old and hasn’t been very interested in walking independently until we started using this! I looked everywhere for a push walker that wouldn’t tip over when a baby pulls up to stand - surprisingly hard to find! This thing is super sturdy and our son loves pulling up by himself and pushing the cart around. He is so proud of his independence and has made great strides after just a couple days of use. If you’re looking for a super sturdy push walker - get this one!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Frikin' adorable
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh! Our 11 month old is adorable waddling along with this! It's perfect! He has an extremely short attention span, but this keeps him busy longer than anything else. The clicking is actually cute along with his waddle. As the previous reviews stated, the clickers can be removed to be less annoying, but that will decrease the resistance. Favorite by far and even my husband is impressed with how much the kid loves it! The babies laughs and giggles with it are all worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Bingobuzz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It did take a bit to built yet once my baby and toddler had so much fun with it. My toddler filled it up with all their toys. I did put the baby in it but he didn't seem to happy. My toddler did get in it and really like it. It's small but it's just the right side for a baby. When my baby was standing while holding on to it, it didn't move, unlike other walkers that have no weight to it and it's dangerous for a baby to use. Overall extremely happy with this purchase. We're a radio flyer family.
customer_reviews.author: Liliana Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Great little walker wagon
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my Grandson's 1st birthday. He quickly took to it and started pushing it down the hall. It has a clicker thing in the wheels so it will not run away when pushing it. He loves pushing it. Within a month and a half he took his first steps without using the wagon. I think the wagon helped with his first steps. It is well made and easy to assemble. And it is just so cute. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: So cute! And it doubles as a toy basket!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little wagon! Love that it's a toy my son can enjoy and it will double as a toy basket in our living room. It's so cute I don't mind having it out. It was a little difficult to put together, definitely follow the instructions closely. But it feels really well made and sturdy. I got it for my 9 month old (who's not quite walking yet, but working on it). It probably moves a little fast for him right now, but I expect he will grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh & Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Walkers' Wagon
customer_reviews.text: Perfect wagon for child learning to walk. The tension in the wheels keeps the child upright - the wagon does not move ahead without the child pushing it. Small children can sit in it and be pushed - a fun activity. It holds blocks and other toys so is effective as a storage unit. I have bought this wagon twice. The first time was almost 6 years ago and it is still in excellent condition after many hours of use and being moved several times. My grandchildren are taught to take care of their toys and so the wagon has not been abused but it has definitely been used a lot.
customer_reviews.author: NDR

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a regular wagon!
customer_reviews.text: You would think as much as this wagon cost and the name brand it would be well made! Nope the wood for the sides is very flimsy and one side broke within the first couple wks my 15 minute nth old had it. The wooden sides do not stay in either the child can take them out so we were constantly having to put them back in their slots. Other than the wood it's a nice wagon but not worth the price you could pay for a regular size one!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Twins are obsessed
customer_reviews.text: My boys are obsessed with this. It's so cute and well made. I was able to put it together in 10 minutes. I love that it has a little plastic piece that tempers the speed of the wheels....its great for one of my boys who is just learning to walk to he essentially runs when he gets behind this hahah One brother gets to ride while the other pushes. Lots of fun...I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sara D.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for baby,  but rails need glue!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old loves to sit and push this wagon back and forth. He isn't pulling up yet, but it is sturdy enough to not topple when he does. He likes the clacking noise when it rolls. I took off one star because the screws on the wooden rails are going to have to be glued together, the wood didn't hold up to the screws and the rails can fall apart easily, leaving a loose screw accessible to small children. I did get mine on an open box (supposedly "like new") deal so for $22 off retail I can deal with it and glue it together, but I imagine that's why it was returned!
customer_reviews.author: A.R. Mageddon

customer_reviews.title: Not all the parts are included some are very important, like axles
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that someone can't count parts, especially important things like axles and the handle Save frustration and put in together before gifting by at least a week or two. What, a Christmas disappointment. Update: I got online and registered the product on Radio Flyer, then reported the parts missing, they overnighted the parts and they came on Christmas Eve. So customer service is very good. So no Christmas Disaster after all! The product is very cute, perfect gift for Christmas, and appears very sturdy once you have all the parts.
customer_reviews.author: bjknebraska

customer_reviews.title: She loved it the second she saw it and realized she ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 1 year old granddaughter who is just starting to try to walk. She loved it the second she saw it and realized she could really walk while holding on. It is a definite hit. She used it on the sidewalks, grass, carpet and did loops helping mom shop in the grocery store. It was easy to put together and seems well made. The bumper is a really good idea too. The only negative is trying to get her to stop and give the little legs a rest.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Home

customer_reviews.title: Toy bin and walker, total must-have
customer_reviews.text: Perfect walker made of real materials and not covered with ridiculous plastic sensory overload buttons. The wheels have a light resistance that prevents the wagon from rolling away with them, and while our baby is learning to use it, it has proved to be well designed not to hurt her legs if she sits down and pulls it over herself. We are very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little walker/wagon
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little walker/wagon. It was really easy to assemble Took only about 15 to 20 minutes to get fully functional. I have eight-month-old twins who are just now learning how to walk and they love pushing each other in it. It has clickers to go on the back wheels that provide a little bit of resistance for the walker. I think this is my favorite feature and why I bought it. Because it slows them down it was let them go flying forward and smack her face is on the ground.I had no issues with any of the products looking like they were coming apart or breaking everything came ready to use and in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: CPfamily

customer_reviews.title: Best walker ever!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on those plastic walkers with the lights and buttons on the front. They tip so easily and anything interesting is on the front of the walker, not the back part the child sees while using it as a walker. My son loves this! It is super sturdy and he likes to put his toys in and out of the wagon, and pull off and put back the rails themselves. A real quality product like you don't often find anymore. I'd give this six stars if I could,
customer_reviews.author: Laura DeSilva

customer_reviews.title: Your child will love this little wagon.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great. My 12 month old grand son loves it. Pushes it all the time. Has helped him to learn to walk. Then he throughs all the toys out and sits in it waiting to be push. Best Buy we’ve made in a toy in a while. One side note, the side rails come off much too easily, so we did not put them on at this time. For his age it is easier without them to put other items in and out of it. We we add them on as he gets a little older. You will love this wagon.
customer_reviews.author: Laureen Gosselin

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this walking learner so much that I purchased one for each of my kids and they're 9 years apart! It is fun, sturdy and it has never fallen over unlike the Walmart or toys r us brands we tried. It also has a speed controlled mechanism so it doesn't take off when it's leaned on. Perfect for learning! They were both walking very soon after this item was purchased. My 3 year old still has hers, it's sturdy enough that she pushes her 2 year old friend around in it.
customer_reviews.author: Mine T

customer_reviews.title: Watch the kids have fun with this wagon! Precious!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this toy and it's precious to see him pushing his little dog in the wagon around the house. It's precious to watch him play with it in different ways as well. He hasn't walked yet but it gives him the confidence to push it around. I highly recommend it to other parents, grandparents or caregivers.
customer_reviews.author: Hoang Chi Truong

customer_reviews.title: Great Walker wagon
customer_reviews.text: We love this walker wagon! Only giving 4 stars because the paint is chipped on one spot and there was another spot on one of the wood side pieces that we had to sand down a little. There was a dent/chip in it that made it rough. Worried about splinters and scrapes for a 1 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Our Grandson Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect little wagon to help a young child learn to walk. Our grandson was just beginning to pull himself up when we got this Radio Flyer for him. In no time he was pushing it around the house and laughing and smiling the whole time. The wagon itself is very well constructed and very sturdy, making it a very good choice for a toddler to play with. His parents love it, too. It's safe and it's good looking! Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MarkSC17

customer_reviews.title: Great toy but not the quality I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: We love the walker wagon! My 11 month old pushes it all over the house. However, after just 1 day, one of the side rails is falling off. (The side rails were already assembled in package). The wood is broken around the screw so it can't be tightened. Also, the red paint was chipped straight out of the package. :( So, while we love the wagon, I'm disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Cute but arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: It is very cute. Was excited to put together. Upon unboxing the wood was chipped and falling off. For the price I paid it shouldn't be damaged. Have to make it work as it is for Easter. But maybe if they put a little more padding in the box this wouldn't happen. This could have easily caused our daughter to get a splinter or eat it. The Walker itself is very cute though. Cant wait for her to try it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie royston

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun. A bit of work to assemble though.
customer_reviews.text: This takes a bit of set up and tools to put together, which was a bit disappointing and meant my daughter wasn’t able to use it as soon as we would have liked. Also, there is no turning capacity, so we have to chase after her and turn it when she runs into something! Otherwise it’s a gorgeous, old school walker. The wooden panels come out so she can put her toys and books in it. Removing the panels develops her fine motor skills. She loves to practice walking all over the house. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Lovely cart 😍
customer_reviews.text: I love this little cart and more importantly my baby loves it as you’ll be able to tell from the video I am including. He plays with the cart every day since we bought it and gets very excited when he sees it. It would make a great gift for a one year old 🎁
customer_reviews.author: Zhajai

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: We gifted this to our son for his first birthday and took his birthday photo shoot in the wagon. The pictures are adorable and he loved sitting in it. It's been a great toy to have and to help him get more mobile. Very well made and right up to par with the other Radio Flyer products we have purchased throughout the years. This was a great buy and will be passed on and hopefully be in the family for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Bozfam

customer_reviews.title: If you’re on the fence, go for this one!
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I splurged on this one instead of one of the less expensive wooden options! It’s the perfect height for my (small) 8mo to pull up and he’s also taking steps with it. He loves to put his toys in and out of it, so it doubles as a cute storage bin that I don’t mind having in our living room. Very sturdy and definitely built to last.
customer_reviews.author: fiona

customer_reviews.title: bought it for my baby that is learning to walk
customer_reviews.text: I bougth it for my baby, she is 1 year old and she is already starting to walk. This is by far my favorite/best option for a push car. Its very sturdy and even tough it is heavier than other push cars, I feel more safe having my baby push this one. Besides, once she will be able to walk by herself, this is a great car for taking to the park with all her stuff, or even around the house. Classic style that never gets old.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy LV

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 1 year birthday present
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a birthday present for our youngest child when he turned one. Not walking at the time, he used it as a walker and actually managed to “walk” around the room. But the more common use is the big kids pushing the baby in it. Adorable! I am so glad I splurged on this instead of one of the cheaper walkers or wagons. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: lauren e

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Purchase
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these for each of our 5 daughters’ babies first birthday. The kids have loved them from day one! One wagon is on its 6th child and still holding up great. We just got our last one (last daughter had her first baby) and it seems as sturdy as the rest. My husband out a part on wrong and broke it, BUT called the company and they sent a new part out that day. I hope the new one continues to hold up as well as the ones we bought 13 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy L.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing walker!
customer_reviews.text: Best walker by far! Don’t hesitate! I bought this for my 3rd child (and wish I had for my first two). Very sturdy with no need to pack the wagon to add weight, easy assembly, and so cute! I’m convinced it helped my daughter to walk much quicker than my first two children!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonprimista

customer_reviews.title: Best Baby Walker/Wagon
customer_reviews.text: This Radio Flyer walker/wagon was a birthday gift for my 1-year-old great grandson which was requested by his mother to help him walk. When he opened his gift, he immediately started using it as a walker & loved it. Less than one month later, he took his 1st steps on his own. This walker/wagon helped teach him to walk & will also last a very long time for h8m to play with.
customer_reviews.author: RCHUSTON

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for a baby/toddler
customer_reviews.text: I love Radio Flyer products and wooden toys. We purchased this wagon for my friend's son's first birthday. He wasn't quite walking yet, so I figured he could grow into this toy. He loves it and actually took his first 'on his own' steps pushing the wagon! It has the perfect amount of space for a few toys or blocks, enough to keep a baby or toddle busy picking up and taking out. It was pretty easy to put together. I felt the hardest part about putting this together, by myself was aligning the pieces to get the screws through. I had to remove a couple to put them in again. Must have a little patience putting it together!
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: I'm hoping once she has better balance standing she'll be able to control it better ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, but I wish it had more resistance. Our 1 year old has to run to keep up with it, which was cute at first but she lost interest very quickly in having to do that. I'm hoping once she has better balance standing she'll be able to control it better so she can walk with it. It seems well made, but I was disappointed the tires weren't rubber. They are plastic, although like other reviewers have said they seem to grip the floor well. >>Update: it's been a year and this little walker wagon has served us very well and is still going strong. A definite good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: the long view

customer_reviews.title: my granddaughter loves!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my granddaughter's first birthday and she loves it! Once she opened it at the party, she didn't want anything to do with the other presents! She's not walking yet, but I know this will help. It is a sturdy toy wagon with bumpers so hopefully won't damage the walls. Easy to put together and who doesn't love the Radio Flyer products? Highly recommend for 10 months through at least 2 years. Will get lots of use!
customer_reviews.author: kpurcell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Very durable and fantastic quality! Gave it to my nephew for 1st birthday and he LOVES it. Taught himself to walk in a couple weeks by pulling up on it and pushing it around. He loves to put his toys in the wagon and go around the house with them.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: Well made, a great design, one of our grandkids favorite toys.
customer_reviews.text: These are very high quality, and a terrific design. Both our granddaughters learned to walk by pushing the wagon around. It's setup so just about when they start standing they can use the wagon to steady themselves while also pushing it around. It really works. What a great toy. We've now bought two.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: Many ways to play!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a Christmas gift for our newly walking one year old. We thought she'd love pushing it around, and she does. Unexpextedly, her favorite thing to do with the wagon is convince her siblings (6, 4) to push her for rides. So cute!
customer_reviews.author: MidwestMomof3

customer_reviews.title: This wagon is so stinkin' CUTE!!! :)
customer_reviews.text: This wagon is beyond adorable! It functions well as a small toy box for the living room! Makes cleaning up toys fast and easy and it is not at all an eye-sore like other plastic contraptions sold to store toys! Also great for new walkers, the clicking noise is super cute and puts a smile on my toddler's face every time! Very, very well-made and even after nearly 6 months of "abuse" from a 1 year old, ours still looks brand new! Definitely something that could be passed down from child-to-child, possibly even over generations! I am a big fan of the Radio Flyer brand, and this little wagon just made me love them even more!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime: expert level - Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: I was intimidated when I took it out of the box and saw all the pieces, but super easy to assemble even for a single mom with too much help from her tot. You need a flat head screwdriver and the right size wrench which I already had on hand. I bought it for my one year old to walk with, but so far she just likes it when I pull her around in it with her toys. I'm sure once she's more stable on her feet, she will be cruising it around. Wheels don't turn...they just go forward and back, but nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: FirsttimeMom

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, little wagon
customer_reviews.text: My husband said 'This was the best thing I have had to put together in a long time!". He said the parts fit and it was easy to assemble. It's a great little wagon for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: smomof2

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied But?
customer_reviews.text: I don’t particularly want customers to see this. We purchased one last year for a grandchild and have been very pleased with it. However the second one we just purchased was damaged. A friend put it together for me and when he was done assembling it, noticed this. Apparently it occurred during shipping. What can we do about it now?
customer_reviews.author: Debby Risner

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced for what it is, wheels don’t spin right, not enough resistance to teach a child how to walk and terrible to maneuver. Poor purchase
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Well made and a hit with my nephew!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nine-month-old nephew and he loves it! Originally came with some incorrect parts, but I called Radio Flyer and they sent me the correct ones. I like "resist push" feature, which basically slows the speed of the wheels so the wagon doesn't go too fast and cause the child to fall forward. Right now he's too young to push it himself but my sister says he LOVES riding in the wagon part!
customer_reviews.author: PA mom

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need to get your crawler walking!  I
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our grandson. We were impressed with the quality and it has been a big hit for our one year old grandson. His little one year old cousin loves it, too. And even the 3 year old cousin likes it. It can also serve as a place to keep toys. This was a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret C.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, well crafted and darling wagon, all in one.
customer_reviews.text: This wagon is awesome and so sturdy. Terrific for someone learning to walk to be able to push. It was easy to put together, except I did use about 6 tools In the process! I was very pleased and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rwolfe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This wagon is very sturdy and our son loves it. Rather hard to turn for a toddler but he’s figuring it out. I only wish it could have a taller handle as well as our son LOVES to be pushed around in it which can be quite the back killer. Overall a fantastic and sturdy toy.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Pain to put together
customer_reviews.text: The assembly is not hard but takes a while and the holes are not drilled accurately - so the wagon I have is a little lopsided. In addition, one of the silicone pegs to make the wheels click is defective - waiting for the manufacturer to send a replacement. You need a hammer, two screwdrivers (phillips and straight) and pliers to put this together.
customer_reviews.author: J. Falk

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 2 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a toddler. Bought it for my 1 yr old’s birthday. He couldn’t bother much with it then but now that he’s almost 2 he LOVES it. He likes to put things in it and push them all around the house. Highly recommend for that age! Very sturdy and easy to assemble. The wooden sides do come out which is actually nice because he can get in and out of it by himself when one side is out.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product and bad return policy mean that this is a risk not ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the toy has really diminished since I bought this for my older son 9 years ago. It's not the same product at all. Plus when I went to return it the seller only accepts returns within 30 days even though the standard is 90 days for baby products. Inferior product and bad return policy mean that this is a risk not worth taking.
customer_reviews.author: seth zalkin

customer_reviews.title: Wish there was a way to hold them in place better. Other than that it's perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. My 10 month old absolutely loves it! The resist setting on the wheel isn't as much as I thought it would be. It's still very fast, but it works and he can keep up with it. The wooden slats on the side go in and out on their own, and my son can pull them off. Wish there was a way to hold them in place better. Other than that it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mrs. Parison

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Great wagon and helper to walk!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wagon. We gave it to an 8 month old and it won't be long til he is up pushing it! He loves it so far. It's going to be great on teaching him to walk and clean up his toys after hauling them around! Safe too. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Nice wagon but for the price a bit more care ...
customer_reviews.text: The wagon requires assembly. The wooden side panels were not well made and the parts that fit into the bed were not even and had to be trimmed. The plastic cone shaped "clickers were very difficult to mount as they were not pre drilled. Nice wagon but for the price a bit more care should have been paid to their quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Edgington

customer_reviews.title: Classic must have
customer_reviews.text: This was a favorite of my grandson when he started to walk. Sturdy for wobblers to stand up. Bought another one for my granddaughter 4 years later because the first one was given away. Cute to put blocks, stuffed animals
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a great Walker. Resistance is not that strong
customer_reviews.text: Bad instruction guide hard to understand. This applies to all the Radio Flyer product. For this walker, resistance is not that strong. Speed is too fast for baby who just started walking. Tiny storage. Not sure if it is worth the money. Maybe works for baby average size. However it doesn't work for our daughter who is 30 inches tall.
customer_reviews.author: Avril Shower

customer_reviews.title: Ended up being a great Christmas gift!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a gift for my nephew for Christmas and he loves it! He was only eight months when we bought it and at first his parents used it to hold toys. Within a couple of months my nephew was pushing his toys around the house! I removed a star because when my husband was putting this together, there was an issue with one of the wood pieces. It was nothing a little wood glue didn't solve. We will likely buy this for or daughter when she's old enough.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Hey

customer_reviews.title: Great wagon
customer_reviews.text: My 14 month old (who isn't walking yet) loves to push this around and did so quite confidently from the start when he first got it a couple months ago. He loves to sit in and pull toys out of it as well. It gets lots of use. Does well on grass too.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and wont pull over when trying to stand up.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Has a limiter on it so it doesnt roll real fast which is great for my grandson. He absolutely loves it. Sure is helping him walk and get places. Haha, his mom and dad are chasing him everywhere now!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Zoom zoom!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fast! When my son first used this at ~8 months, an adult always had to place their hand on the other end to slow it down for support. Now that he's walking, the speed is fine but it's unfortunate that it doesn't make turns easily. I regret buying; should've just bought the cheap plastic one with music and stuff on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: mc_SSTJ

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our boy for Christmas. He was 8 months old at the time and loved it immediately. He's 11 months old now and still racing around the house with it, sometimes with our cat in the cart. He gets such a huge smile pushing it around. I'd recommend it to anyone thinking of getting one.
customer_reviews.author: brazteca

customer_reviews.title: Great product - get it, totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great little wagon! We got this as my 7 month old was very interested in walking. At first she couldn’t push it herself (we have thick carpet) so we helped her out. But now at 8 months she practices walking with this all the time. I can foresee her using it a lot in the future as well! I love that it serves a purpose (it’s a wagon that can hold things) and isn’t just some thing she’ll be uninterested in once she is walking on her own. The only thing I don’t like is how easy the wagon rails come out, I just wish you couldn’t pull them out so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 3 1/2 year old to push my 6 month old down the aisle at a wedding and should work perfectly! It is currently storing the baby’s toys. We push it out to the living room during the day and then load it back up and night and roll it back to his room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FAIL. was shipped a defective wagon.
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited about this. Unfortunately the one that was shipped to me was totally defective. the front axle/bolts that are supposed to hold the wheels on dont work at all. missing threading and too short. Even without this, the assembly is NOT quick and easy (took me an hour and I am a professional industrial designer) and overall shoddy workmanship--many of the holes dont line up or are too small unless you hammer the pieces through. If it actually went together it would probably be awesome. HUGE disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: zwow

customer_reviews.title: Good size. Mostly wood. Durable
customer_reviews.text: Super cute. Bought it for my baby. I like that it's mostly wood. I was expecting metal being it's a radio flyer. Super happy it's not made out of all plastic. The wheels are plastic and the bumper is plastic. Wasn't to hard to assemble. Cute. Perfect size for a newly walking baby.
customer_reviews.author: HBMom

customer_reviews.title: Adorable
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely adorable. Purchased it for my one year old son for his birthday. He loves walking with it. It seems really sturdy and I can see it lasting us a while. We did have some difficulty assembling it. Some of the parts just were not easy to put together and it became a two person job. But overall we are happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: thelittlemermaid

customer_reviews.title: adorable wagon
customer_reviews.text: really cute and my son likes to walk it around the family room. the sides come out very easily so my kids like to pull them out and i have to put them back in all the time, but that's their own fault. i like that the wheels make a clicking sound so i can hear when they're using it (so i can watch in case of any issues with falling/getting stuck/running something over). the bumper seems to do the job and it can be used for storage when not being played with.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, love the slow push so my sisters newly walking baby doesn’t tumble over while playing with it. She loves putting her kittys in it!
customer_reviews.author: adriana coulman

customer_reviews.title: The best walker wagon I could find.  Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This push wagon is simply the best I could find for my grandson. It is pricey, but well worth it. The actioned is braked a bit so that it won’t slip out from under the new walking toddler. Toddlers will play with a walker wagon like this throughout the preschool years. I suspect that this one will be passed down to the next generation.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful walker and wagon
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing walker wagon. Has a great look and very sturdy. At first our baby was intimidated of it but we kept it near so he gets familiar. I would take him to it every once in a while. And then one day he crawl towards it and started walking behind it. It was amazing. Now he walks without a walker but he loves pushing it around with his stuffed animals in it. We had another baby over for a play date and they both loved pushing each other in it. It’s such a great item to have and keep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safety features already added!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for our friends who have an 8 month old, but is starting to walk. My boyfriend put it together and we put a bow on it, and I have to say I love this walker so much! It has safety features installed so that the walker can’t just roll wherever. Totally buying another next year for my best friend who is giving birth in January
customer_reviews.author: Jilly P

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than i expected
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy but a bit smaller than I expect for 1.5year old I probably should have gotten it for him last year would have been better but now it's just a bit too small. For the product itself, I would recommend getting it for a 6-12 month-year-old once they have a handle of walking not much more of a use for it nice for photos though
customer_reviews.author: Brian k burt jr

customer_reviews.title: Great quality wagon
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our daughters for Christmas. They are 4 and 2 (32 and 25 pounds) and both fit in the wagon. They enjoy pushing each other and can fit many things in here. It is versatile and can be used for all kinds of fun, indoor and out.
customer_reviews.author: T&GHall

customer_reviews.title: Still too fast for a new walker
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old is pulling up and taking steps with support, so i thought this would be great to help her learn to walk. Even when I filled it full of heavy books, it will fly out from under her unless I'm holding it. But the construction is good and it looks really nice, so I guess she'll have fun with it once she can walk and push it without leaning on it.
customer_reviews.author: DamDamDammy

customer_reviews.title: No one-year old learning to walk should be without it
customer_reviews.text: Radio Flyer wins the prize for surviving the generations with great products. I still remember my own RadioFlyer wagon.
customer_reviews.author: Ready4Retirement

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We sent this to a 1 year old. Her parents say she loves it. She puts her toys in it and it has really helped her improve her walking. They've used it both inside and out.
customer_reviews.author: EGR

customer_reviews.title: Looks used, had to chase threaded inserts to assembly
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited about this for our son. However after opening the box to build this so he can see it on Xmas morning. The paint is scratched and dinged. On top of that luckily I own a tap and die set because two of the threaded bits were completely chewed up. The bolts would not even turn one thread. We cannot ship this back because we really want it for Xmas morning. After assembly it looks used due to the scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Dusti Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Nicest walker EVER
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this walker for our grandson. Very easy to assemble. Very sturdy. I purchased from the "NEW/USED section at a significant discount. Love this walker.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy cart
customer_reviews.text: Great quality cart with just the right amount of mobility that my one year old can be supported and yet still walk and push it around without it taking off. Just wish the wheels swiveled so that he could turn it. My older kids can turn it but my one year old doesn’t have the ability yet.
customer_reviews.author: Popmakr4

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for an 8 month old baby. He received it on Christmas Day and took his first steps within minutes! Later he sat in it to play with his toys.
customer_reviews.author: My2nicks

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Fun photography prop—recommended Sides are removable. Easy to put together and includes clicker tab, if you are so inclined on the install—we were not.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Quality toy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this walker when our first was 9 months old, in 2014. It mostly has been used inside and for periods of time stored away but it has been played with A LOT. It’s got a few chips on the backside but overall it’s holding up amazing. Especially considering my kid is now 5 and hasn’t exactly been gentle with it most the time! Seriously a sturdy toy. Baby number two is arriving soon and I can’t wait to see them play in it together!
customer_reviews.author: Jlbfield

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: One of my 10 month old son's favorite gifts. He loves filling up the wagon and walking all over the house. He quickly has learned how to back up and turn the wagon. He's also small enough to sit inside it (He's 27 inches and 24 lbs) while I push him around. The front bumper is padded, which keeps my walls still looking good!
customer_reviews.author: Angie C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product.. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for our grandson who absolutely loves it. He will take the end piece off and sit in the wagon and read and then he will push the wagon around with his books or toys! Can't say enough about how great this wagon is!!!! Works well indoors or outdoors! The clicker on the wheels keeps it from rolling too fast, but it is a smooth ride.
customer_reviews.author: lcom4

customer_reviews.title: great first flyer for curious (but not ready to walk) babies
customer_reviews.text: My son is turning 8 months soon and is so curious already about walking. This is the perfect transition walker as it's not too easy to push where he will fall, but entertaining enough where he can just stand up & enjoy a new toy. (Note: I keep this on a shag rug and it works perfect) The box came in great shape (instructions could have been labeled a little better) but overall awesome product! We love our first flyer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but Paint Came Off
customer_reviews.text: It was very cute and the child loved it. I was pleased with my purchase, but disappointed as well. When putting it together, the white pinstriped paint smudged on my leg, like it wasn't dry. I was bummed. I bought some white nail polish to try and fix it. Perhaps no one will notice, but I knew it wasn't as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: elisa kathleen esteves

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality parts
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in the quality of the machined parts for this wagon, screws, bolts etc. And I’m not a novice at assembly. Once completed it’s really cute.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: (a) Our baby loved it from the moment he saw it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: (a) Our baby loved it from the moment he saw it. He climbed into it and loves being pushed around the house in this wagon. (b) It is decent size to comfortably fit a big toddler Cons: (a) the wheels on our wagon are so wobbly that they already rubbed off the red paint from the wagon, after less than a week of use. (b) overall red paint comes off VERY easily. I would give it 4 starts if not for the wheels issue.
customer_reviews.author: Etcetera

customer_reviews.title: Cute sturdy little wagon for baby’s first steps and to ride in before that.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my grand baby and she loves it! It’s sturdy and cute and has a click when the wheels turn. It’s perfect for her to ride in until she can push it herself when she starts taking her first steps! Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Koda

product_meta.title: Radio Flyer Classic Walker Wagon, Sit to Stand Toddler Toy, Wood Walker, Red, Model Number: 612s
product_meta.description: Style:Classic WalkerClassic, safe and versatile, this award-winning push wagon is a favorite for children and parents alike. The "resist push" feature allows beginner walkers to safely build confidence and balance. Removable wooden stake sides add to the fun and the furniture friendly bumper protects your home as your little one learns to walk . The product features durable molded wheels with grip tread for comfort and travel
feature_bullets: BABY PUSH WALKER: The Classic Walker Wagon has resistance clickers to allow beginners to build confidence and balance. The resistance clickers prevent the product from moving too quickly
FURNITURE BUMPER: The furniture friendly bumper protects your home while beginners learn to walk. This round bumper will prevent scratches or wall damage
TOY STORAGE: The Classic Walker Wagon doubles as a toy box. Your toddler can store their favorite toys for imaginative play indoors or bring them with on walking adventures
CLASSIC DESIGN: The natural all-wood body and removable wooden side panels create this classic look
SPECIFICATIONS: Assembled dimensions are 22.4“ L x 14.6“ W x 17.1” H. Interior body dimensions are 22.5” L x 10.25” W. For ages 1 – 4 years

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,656 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
